column13: Great place, excellent food and very good service.
Very accommodating to a large group.

column4: 2015 Monterey Street San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: Excellent food, friendly staff, and cute gift shop. Being able to reserve on Open Table was a plus because it's always busy here. Large selection of menu items and although a littly pricey the portions were large and tasted great. My teenagers and hubby ate every bite. We'll be sure to stop here on future trips.
Very good food. Chef and owner attentive and friendly . Waitstaff good. Good service. Won't break the bank even with wine bottle ordered. Don' t expect anything but strip center ambience though.

We've been coming in for a few years and have never been disappointed. The only reason we don't come more often is because we'd order everything. We always find something new to try and have loved each discovery.
Classic French style restaurant. Quiet and intimate. Nice ambience and view of a courtyard with fountains and flowers. Food is quite good and pricy.

Our reservation was made perfectly through open table.We all arrived and the wait staff particularly Demetri and Marco were very well trained and had great customer service.We chose this venue due to the fact that our group was mostly made up of out of state pro league Bocce players.The food and service we had was amazing,the ambiance was awesome.We were greatly looking forward to play a couple rounds.We saw there was a roller and lute so we started to roll and lute the court in order to play.We were met with very sharp orders to stop.That we couldn't use those.Mostly because it was dinner time and it was distracting from dinner.I fully understand, however it would have been nice to have a sign out, rather than embarrassing paying customers

I was disappointed in the service this time. It took so much time to even get a glass of water. I'm not sure why, but it seemed we were just a bother to them. I wondered if they were just angry that we used OpenTable to make the reservation.

We went looking for a steakhouse, after so much seafood in California. The steaks were ok, but not great. The fish was also good. the service was a little slow and lacking. We were a group of 8, and to order dessert the waitress gave us 2 dessert menus!!!Also, some of us in the group wanted a expresso coffee after dinner, and they don't have.

column4: 7166 Carmel Valley Rd. Carmel Valley, CA  93923
column13: We our from out of town.. This restaurant was highly recommend to us. We made reservations on Sunday for Tuesday night knowing it was lobster night, but when making reservations thru open table we did not know you had also reserve a lobster on that night. Thank goodness when we got there they still had two left. The for was good but our server (pretty sure her name was Veronica) did a poor job. She messed up ur whole order. We saw a manager when we first got there but not later. Probably would have enjoyed our dinner better if the service was better. When we ask for sour cream it took almost 10 minutes and the food was getting cold waiting. Asked for a salad with lettuce and cheese only and she brought out a salad with everything.
Excellent meal. House cured salmon carpacio was tops.Halibut with mashed potatoes, teriffic and lamb with au gratin potatoes was super. PG is lucky to have Taste.

column4: Dolores St. between Ocean & 7th Avenue Carmel-By-The-Sea, CA  93921
column13: Good environment and decor. Again, love the Souffle.
Stellar food. Friendly end efficient service. Charming ambience. Don't miss this little gem!!!! We are glad we didn't!!!

column4: 1037 Monterey St. San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: The patio was intimate & airy, the food was fantastic! We had an amazing dinner, the service was impeccable!!!

column1: Cafe Beach Restaurant at Beach Resort Monterey
column13: My boyfriend and I went to dinner, hoping for some good seafood. I ordered the sea bass, which was delicious and perfectly cooked, while he had the salmon. I think that salmon was the worst I have ever tasted. It was dry, flavorless and just not very good. The red pepper coulis that went along with it was also flavorless. The garlic mashed potatoes were good, but we didn't spend $20+/entree for mashed potatoes. I suppose we should have complained, but our waiter was not around much.The view was amazing, as we were right on the water, so I guess we were paying for the ambiance. It's unfortunate that the food wasn't better because we wanted to like this place.In the end, I guess I would recommend it but with hesitation.

column4: Ocean Avenue & Monte Verde St Carmel-by-the-Sea, CA  93921
column13: I had the delicious Sardegna regional meal. It was excellent as made by the Italian chef!!! My husband had filet which he said was excellent. WE also had the calamari appetizer that was very good. The desert of gelato layers on a cinnamon crust was outstanding. We had a wonderful 37th anniversary dinner.

This was our first time at Christopher's and we were favorably impressed. The room was pleasent with lots of windows. Our waiter was knowledgeably and helpful. Our first courses were outstanding; one of the best corn soups I've had, and an albacore carpaccio to die for. The second courses were slightly less successful, but still delicious. Definitely recommended.

Nice early dinner menu, but was not offered when we came in at 5:45pm. We asked for it and choose from it the Prime Rib which comes with mached potatoes.We paid additional for a baked potatoe. The Prime rib was excellent and the baked potatoe was very large and had a great filling.

I wish that I could check something lower than "poor" for the food quality. We ordered the grilled artichokes, Paella, and vegetarian pasta. The artichokes were overwhelmed with the balsamic marinade, and were poorly trimmed (as in, the knives they used were clearly not sharp). The Paella was exceptionally dry and tasteless to boot. The vegetarian pasta was supposed to have a pesto sauce, but I believe they did not use pine nuts or even basil. The dish was bland and I regretted having to eat the vegetables in butter with mushy noodles. I never pass on dessert, but with dinner being as over priced (over $30 for the paella alone) and under flavored as it was, I figured I'd rather have ice cream from the grocery store.

The moment you walk in the door the aromas grip you and one starts to realize this isn't your typical southwestern fare. Creative and flavorful menu, their ribs are more than ribs, the tenderloin is succulent and packed with a smokey yummy flavor and the halibut with papaya and mango is refreshing. Empanadas appetizer are so good you'd wished they came as a dinner entree. Inventive cocktails.
Waitresses need to be trained, had to ask for everything three times, and no cheese for pasta. Also, the reported to Open Table that we did not dine.

Service was not that great - mostly just toss your dinner on the table and they are gone. Porkchop was dry, waiter said Yeah I know they are it probably should have some kind of sauce on it and than he left the table. for the price you pay they should be a little more concerned.

We LOVE Cilantro's....Courtney called us to let us know the server we requested Jeanette was not going to be on for our 5:30 p.m. reservation..what amazing customer service. We of course waited for our favorite server...always a smile, great communication and knows what we like:~)

The waiter was pleasant and punctual, but the food took 45 minuted because apparently the cook "lost our order". Everyone around us (folks who came after, seemed to get and nearly finish their meals by the time we got ours)Then when we got it, it wasn't fully cooked. Wasn't the anniversary dinner I was hoping for by any means. After all the above, no discount either.
The best and most friendly service I've had in the U.S.A. (Thanks, JosÃ©) Food was good. The portions are massive, you could dine on a starter and not go away hungry. In all, a very enjoyable meal.
Attentive and friendly staff, great Hawaiian cuisine (an alternative to higher priced Roy's at Spanish Bay), and far away from the Monterey/Carmel tourist crowds.

Had reservations for 2 for lunch @ 2:00 at Sanderlings. Returned my Grilled Salmon NiÃ§oise as salmon was particularly dry and salty. The potatoes in the salad were an interesting addition though the purple ones tasted moldy. The same salad was brought back with half of hard boiled egg replaced, and the remainder of the partially eaten purple potato. Was taken aback as the salad wasn't fresh, especially after all that time.

We eat at Tarpy's every year when we are in Monterey. For a couple of years, it seemed to have gone down hill a little, but this year it came back strong! All four of us were very happy with every aspect of the meal and service.

This was my second time dining at Downey's. The food is always amazing. The service is very slow but the staff was polite and we appreciated Liz Downey coming by our table to say hello. I'll definitely go back again, just not if I'm on a tight schedule.
Fresh fish speciality but my encrusted se was soggy and tasteless despite capers. Baked potato was not hot.
Lovely spot in Paso, great local food and wine menu. Everything we ordered was OUTSTANDING!

column1: Andres Bouchee Bistro and Wine Bar
column13: I would like to rate this restaurant higher, and would if they paid attention to the service aspect. The food was outstanding, nice decor, but the service was lacking. The restaurant was not busy and our service started out good but slowly deteriorated. Towards the end of our meal, the chef and the manager were busy chatting up a couple of tables that were speaking French. While they chatted, we waited and waited and waited. There are a lot of very good restaurants in Carmel, so next time we will give some of the others a try.

Food was very average. Only one or two items that I would call "tasteful!". The rest were too blend. Dining roon was way to warm. The most annoying is, waitress said "tonight all wine is 30% off". We were excited at first. Only to find out that it was just a gimmick. We ordered the first bottle of wine, a few min later waitress came back and said they were out of that. Ok , fine. We picked another one. Once again it was out. So we ordered a thrird outle. Sorry, out again. Really? On a night that you said all wine is 30% off? And just happened that the good wine is all out? We can't help but wonder this is how they decide to hide the good wine from the 30% sale. Will not go back again.
Our party of five had a wonderful time at the Pino Alto Restaurant. The entire staff that we met was wonderful and we enjoyed the food very much. I have already recommended it to friends.

It was early evening, so the restaurant was still fairly quiet with very few customers. But business picked up a lot as I sat and enjoyed my dinner. The ahi tuna was cooked beautifully and tasted great. I have a weakness for parmesan fries, and Arch Rock Fish fries could definitely compete with the best. A just-spicy-enough Bloody Mary completed the meal and made me mellow. Overall, I would definitely recommend this as a great place to go in Santa Barbara
Too "shop worn" and a real tourist trap. Seemed like a carnival atmosphere. Wait staff and hosts jackets and aprons appeared soiled front and back.

We had a wonderful meal at Domenico's. Despite a same day reservation and being somewhat busy, they were able to accommodate my request for a window seat. Watching first the seals on a platform in the harbor was a hoot, and the sun setting on the mountains in the distance beautiful. As for food, everything we tried was good to very good. The grilled sardines and garlic are a must for appetizer. For main course, we had king crab legs straight from the 'Time Bandits' boat in the discovery channel show. They were a bit salty but good. We also ordered the steamed dungeness crab which was tasty in spite of being out of season. The service was pleasant, and very attentive without being intrusive. I would recommend Domenico's.

column4: On 6th Avenue between Dolores & San Carlos Carmel-by-the-Sea, CA  93921
column13: Service was excellent, they were attentive and "watched out" for us the entire meal.

I have visited this restaurant since i was a child with my parents and now i can take my children. They have the best food, the best service, best location and view! You cannot go wrong here. Look forward to my next visit, soon!

Huge disappointment. Had a 7:45 reservation. Seated at 8:15. Waited 55 minutes for bread. Ordered fresh oysters for an appetizer. I have never seen oysters with so little meat before. Waitress said they were "Morro Bay" oysters. With no exaggeration...the oyster flesh was perhaps 1/4 inch by 1/4 inch. Ordered a salad with a vinaigrette dressing. It tasted like vegetable oil. Absolutely flavorless. I had scallops which were good. My wife had a pasta with sardine dish that was very good. Service was abysmal. Staff was friendly. Managers tried to pitch in to help the hopelessly overworked waitresses. Only 2 waitresses and 1 busboy for the entire restaurant on a Saturday night? Really? Can not recommend.

column4: 450 Marsh Street San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: This was our fourth dinner at Gennaro's. Again, we were delighted with all courses of our meals and the attentive, courteous staff. My girlfriend's eggplant entree topped the best we've had in San Francisco, her new favorite...and maybe mine!

We booked through Open Table and had to wait for about 15 mins to be seated because our table wasn't ready. The service was painfully slow. The food was ok, but the mashed potatoes tasted like it had waited too long under the heating lights or maybe reheated. It was a bit disappointing as it was recommended to me as one of the best restaurants in Capitola.

column4: 415 West Carmel Valley Rd Carmel Valley, CA  93924
column13: I highly recommend the Chef's tasting menu - and the staff was very amiable in substituting some items for me since I was pregnant, without any noticeable difficulty. The service was outstanding and the food was delicous - worth the price!

column4: 415 Carmel Valley Rd Carmel Valley, CA  93924
column13: Great food from a celebrity chef. Outdoor dining with a huge fireplace and a view of the croquet grounds.

column4: 1126 Morro St. San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: Great spot for tapas and drinks. I would of given it a five had it not been undergoing construction.

We both thought these were the best meals we had ever eaten! amazing food and unexpected and harmonious combinations. we had speck and eggplant appetizers which were amazing combinations of somewhat unlikely components, adding up to much more than the sum of the parts; duck and swordfish mains both fantastic... we went back the next evening to try more of the menu, and some wine flights which we also enjoyed very much (a solid "A") although not as stellar as the first night (A++)

column4: 46840 Highway 1 Highway One at Pheneger Creek Big Sur, CA  93920
column13: I went here for a romantic date on a Sunday. They had live music and fantastic food. We had the fried artichokes, the portobello sandwich, brisket sandwich, and the brownie sundae with dessert. Our waiter was on point in filling the wine glasses, the food came out quickly and was hot, and we can't wait to go back again for a sunny, romantic afternoon.

column4: 9 West Victoria St. Santa Barbara, CA  93101
column13: Was recommended by the staff at our local Santa Barbara Hotel as "farm to table" and it didn't disappoint. Lovely atmosphere and outstanding waiter. And the absolute best "wine by the glass" menu I've ever seen! (over 48 to choose from!) Don't forget dessert - the white chocolate bread pudding was fabulous...

We have been numerous times for lunch, but really enjoyed the dinner with our friends. We are all high school friends and were both celebrating our 48th Anniversaries. It was a memorable and enjoyable time.

column4: 1020 Railroad Ave San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: Booked Cafe Roma for our anniversary trip to San Luis Obisbo. The bruschetta was good. I ordered the wild salmon and my wife ordered the beef ravioli. My salmon was good but a bit overcooked. My wife's ravioli was a bit too al dente for her tastes. All in all, ho hum but not horrible.

Food was good, beer list is impressive. The atmosphere is pleasant until 9 pm, when the DJ begins playing club music at a volume which prevents conversation with those across the table from you. Otherwise, it's a great spot, the servers are professional, engaging, and the food service is quick.

column4: Dolores St. between Ocean and 7th Carmel, CA  93921
column13: The ambiance, food and service was wonderful. The menu selection made it hard to decide. From the soup to the entree,to dessert, everything was delicious. We each had something different and loved all our choices.

column4: 1212 Coast Village Road Santa Barbara, CA  93108
column13: We ordered four dishes, all were delicious, and the service was excellent. The chicken quesadilla and the rock shrimp tacos were a standout. Don't bother with the pomegranate margarita, not worth it.
Not your typical "mexican" restaurant. Much more upscale. Excellent drinks and food.

I was pleasantly surprised by our dining experience at Johnny's Harborside Grill. The service was great and very attentive! The food was all delicious and the presentation was lovely. It was an overall great experience. I have already recommended Johnny's and will continue to do so, and I will be back to enjoy the magic again.

I have heard people complain that the prices are like a SanFran pestaurant BUT SO IS THE QUALITY!! I think this is the BEST spot in all of Santa Cruz and worth every dollar!! I am happy to have a restaurant comparable to those in the City right here funky little Santa Cruz. The courtyard is perfect for lunch or a warm summer evening. Go to Yelp to see more reviews and pictures of the dishes. Great spot!!

column4: 1279 Coast Village Road Santa Barbara, CA  93108
column13: Love , love, loved the brunch/breakfast menu-- who knew a steakhouse would be such a great am place????

column4: 1023 Chorro Street San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: excellent food. great setting and wonderful menu

column1: Madonna Inn - Alex Madonna's Gold Rush Steak House
column4: 100 Madonna Road San Luis Obispo, CA  93405
column13: Great Steaks and Prime Rib is a given. The abalone was also great. Our server was wonderful and gave us just the right amount of attention while still giving us the space we wanted for our romantic dinner.

Service was very poor. We were a group of 6 and we sat outside and felt we were forgotten all night. Had to request for everything utensils, bread etc. Four of the six meals came out together and the other two came late. I was celebrating my birthday and my dish was one of the ones that was served late. When my meal did arrive it was cold and unappetizing. Also there heat lamps were not working. Unfortunately we were sat by the heat lamp that didn't work. Michael's was hosting a high school reunion that night and it was a busy night and perhaps that is why the service was so poor. However, I believe they should have planned for the extra business.

Recommended by Marriott in Paso Robles where we spent the night on the way to Monterey. We booked before we left home in Scottsdale Arizona and were not disappointed. good meal, wine and service. We will recommend to friends and family!
excellent service and was very accomidating to a vegan in our party. food was very good, different interesting
second time visit , looking forward to many more....

The Sardine Factory is one of those rare restaurants that is the absolute go-to place for any special occasion. They are ideally located in Cannery Row. Not only do they offer a delicious assortment of menu items, wines and delectable desserts, every room has a special ambiance. You should see the atrium dining room! The staff is exceptional, as well, first class. They are totally worth a visit for personal and/or business functions.

column1: Schooners Coastal Kitchen & Bar â€“ Monterey Plaza Hotel & Spa
column13: My wife and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary with a return to the venue of our wedding dinner--then called The Duck Club. The recently renovated restaurant was delightful, the staff very attentive, and the food very good. Though the room doesn't have the charm and romantic flavor of its old self, it is extremely nice by today's standards and reflects the host Monterey Bay Hotel's need to serve a wide range of guests. The menu has quite a few selections, but it downplays main course entrees in favor of that selection, expecially for seafood. Given its access to both the ocean and the great agricultural sources of the Salinas Valley, I expected to have some really wonderful items from which to choose. All were cooked to perfection

column4: 30 E. Ortega St. Santa Barbara, CA  93101
column13: We spend 5 or 6 weekends a year in Santa Barbara.......we have eaten across the street for years at Paradise, and have seen SeaGrass but looked a bit stuffy for our taste. An offer on TravelZoo brought us there, and we were delighted. Food, ambiance, service were all outstanding. We will definately go back...with or without a "deal".

I have eaten at Sly's a number of times with good to excellent results. However, on my most recent visit, two of us ordered the seafood tower for $47.00 each! I thought for $47.00 it would be exceptional. When the towers were served, we should have refused them at that moment. However, we just went ahead and ate the items on the tower: shredded crab meat instead of lump crab meat sitting in water. Most of the ice had melted. Tiny cocktail shrimp also sitting in water. Three very small oysters which did not taste fresh sitting in water. The menu said the tower had 1/2 of a lobster. It had 1/2 of a very small lobster -- looked like a crawfish. The whole thing was a mess and very over priced.
Gnocchi light and tasty. Grilled peaches -- excellent. Small menu, great choices.

I stayed at the Ojai Valley Inn and Spa this past week and was recommended highly by the staff to dine at Suzannes. The wait staff and ambiance was pleasant, with well groomed and lovely outdoor gardens. The food in contrast, was overpriced given the portions, quality and presentation. My daughter and I both had the zucchini bloosoms starter, stuffed with ricotta in a pink sauce. Since zucchini bloosoms are scarely a restaurant offering, we both jumped at the opportunity and they were good, and fairly priced. I ordered the bleu cheese filet for dinner, which at $35, was overpriced and underwhelming. The bleu cheese was ontop the filet, not encrusted, and the filet was a bit chewy, and lacking flavor. I ended up exchanging it for soup.

column4: 1250 Coast Village Rd. Santa Barbara, CA  93108
column13: The food it fantastic as usual. However, the service has gone down quite a bit. We eat her quite often and noticed that this time around the wait staff was not as attentive. 1) We had to ask several times for high chair for our son, to several different people. 2) It took them a while to get the bottle of wine we ordered to the table. The food took longer then normal to come out. 3) When I had asked for my left overs to be boxed up it was never returned to me. The waitress had to go back to look for it as we were leaving.

column4: 690 Higuera St. San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: We had rehersal dinner for 22 people on a Saturday night....was very nice...no problems....staff very happy....
Great experience!! Incredible food!!

The chef is so wonderful! We had a party of 4, and 2 were vegetarian. They were happy to accommodate us, and the vegetarian entrees and starters were out -of- this- world good! We will definitely be back soon. Thank you to the Ballard Inn and the chef!

column1: The Restaurant at JUSTIN Vineyards & Winery
column13: One of the best dinning experiences you can have. Just bring $$$$. Wines are very fairly priced.

My husband and I each had the Friday night special- prime rib. It was fabulous!! Cooked perfect for each of us and it was so tender...the knife just glided through it. Served with mashed potatoes and string beans. Couldn't have been more pleased. I made the reservation using open table. This was my first time using open table and it was so easy. We walked in, they had the reservation, and off we went to our table. Thank you for a wonderful experience.
made reservations here for our second date...outstanding service...soooooo romantic...food is perfect...we will be back soon...thank you Fish Hopper for everything

Cigare Volant is a paragon of contemporary cuisine in an unassuming location. Next to gigantic barrels, you enter a converted warehouse now used for wine making, tasting, and beer brewing, right across from railroad tracks. The inside hasn't changed since it was the Tasting Room and still consists of exquisite transformations of wine-making detritus. However. the food is quite a bit different. Dishes are smaller and more naturally shared, and techniques such as foams and shells created from liquid nitrogen fit in. The tastes are still the best in Santa Cruz, and as expected there's still the commitment to local farms and fresh, in-season ingredient.s

Love the food at TG - - pork milanese was awesome, huge portions...two of us shared the seafood platter (and still had leftovers) ..great wine list (had local winemaker di bruno vino)..nice staff..but WAY too noisy inside when the restaurant is packed...maybe the porch next time? Nice waitress...

column1: Lido Restaurant @ Dolphin Bay Resort & Spa
column4: 2727 Shell Beach Road Pismo Beach, CA  93449
column13: Duck Hash on their brunch and breakfast menu is to die for!

column4: 7 East Anapamu Street Santa Barbara, CA  93101
column13: Beautiful outdoor patio with draped canvas ceiling to block direct sunlight. The carrot soup was terrific! One of our favorite lunch spots.

This is my favorite restaurant in the Monterey/ Carmel area especially on Thursday nights when authentic Swiss/Austrian music is played by a violinist, accordion player, and other accompanists. We always have one of their fondue dishes, but there are other "lighter" entrees also. And Stiegl Beer on draft. A favorite of my university days in Vienna. Looking forward to our next visit!
So far Main Street Garden is 2 for 2, great food and wine!!

Excelent service and view. Nice ambiance. Food uneven and over complicated when not needed. STARTERS: oysters extremely fresh and tasty. Would be nice to put the size number in the menu though, calmari very good, shrimo coctail very average (meaning great shrimo but poor coctail). General comment - ketchup is not a sauce. Sauce for shrimp coctail is made out of mayones tomato sauce and wircester sause and could have some horseradish or chilli or sth. MAINS: ahi tuna very tasty but vegetables tastless. Pie was a distaster. Lobster good except for the sauce. It would be easier to grill.it and give butter aside. It is the easiest way and gives the fresh taste.. I liked coleslaw. Very good hamburger. Salmon good.
Great food,great location. Very pleasant atmosphere.

column4: 2757 Shell Beach Rd Pismo Beach, CA  93449
column13: Marisol is, hands down, my favorite ocean-front restaurant in San Luis Obispo county. Whenever friends or relatives are in town, I bring them to Marisol. The food and drink are consistently excellent and the interior design, service staff and musical entertainment combine to create an atmosphere that is very welcoming and festive. Add a spectacular view and the result is a most enjoyable and memorable dining experience.

Unusual fusion of Mexican & Italian cuisine. The dishes were very good, having a number of the smaller plates in order to sample, could not get enough. Menus was extensive, all fresh ingredients. The calamari & chorizo pizza were just two that were fabulous, must visit & experience.

Went to Far Western with my wife for our anniversary. This is one of those classic steak houses your grandparents visited. You won't find the ambiance and exotic dishes of the prime steakhouses that are popular nowadays. Here you get a slab of meat with fries and beans. Both my wife and I had the rib-eye steak. While it wasn't the best steak I ever had it was good and we had an enjoyable time listening to the vineyard owners talk about bringing in this years harvest.
The food was outstanding and the service amazing. We ate on the patio overlooking the pacific. It could not have been better.

column1: Lodge Restaurant at Carmel Valley Ranch
column13: Very nice experience. Nested in the middle of the Carmel woods, this hotel is elegant, contemporary, and fits very well with its surroundings. The service is attentive without being over-bearing. The restaurant is excellent by the way.

Walked out before ordering food because, smart "A" 18 year old wine kid(who I had never seen before) refused to open a fresh bottle of $15 a glass Pinot; he thought that 1 to 2 to ?? day old stuff that had been sitting around was just fine! Unfortunately, it was one of the reasons the old Piati failed: serving up swill and charging market price! This was my 4th visit here with new chef: Jake; who I thought was doing a good job.....when he's in the kitchen. I called aheard to see if he was cooking because on last visit halibut entre got sent back for overcooking by someone when he was off. On these 4 prior visits, staff was happy to make sure I got a fresh glass of premium pinot. WAKE UP PIERRE, YOU"RE IN WINE COUNTRY!

column4: 570 Higuera St. Suite 130 San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: In a word, "Awesome".

How can I describe how wonderful our experience was? The service is impeccable and sincere. The food was absolutely flawless and full of so much flavor, it left this foodie without words. It was romantic and the view out into the mountains was breathtaking. I can't imagine a better time.

column4: 726 Higuera Street San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: The only challenge we had was the bugs flying around. There was a huge black beatle on out table and a praying mantis on my friends back!
too small portions for the price
Highly recommend: crab cakes, baked brie, beef short ribs were fork tender, and bread pudding. Will definitely come back the next time we are in the area.

We had a lovely meal, for my hubbies birthday. Great wine list and server very knowledgable. We shared a salad, which tasted great but they never brought us an additional plate. My husband had the halibut over faro which was fantastic!!! I did have food envy. I ordered the lamb, which was cooked perfectly, but overwhelmed by the sauce. My recommendations: make a reservation no matter what night of the week. Walk down and take the cable car up. The Shawdowbrook is beautiful and in a beautiful location.

We were new to the area and found this place not too far from our hotel. The food was good and the serving generous. It was a shame that I couldn't finish my lamb shank entree. It was delicious but since we were staying at a hotel, there was no way for me to store it or reheat it. The rest in our group were quite satisfied with their meals. Will definitely be back here next time we're in town.

It was an nice affordable place to eat at the last minute on a Friday night during the Pebble Beach Concours weekend. We had a group of six adults. They provided us a private dining room to celebrate two 10 year anniversaries and one 15 year wedding anniversary. However, they didn't acknowledge it or provide anything else to make it special even though it had been noted on the OpenTable reservation. The drink menu was limited - no fancy bar drinks and very limited domestic beer selection. The oysters were mediocre but the shrimp was fabulous. The beet salad was dry with a tiny marble sized ball of fried feta cheese. The desserts were incredible especially the homemade blueberry pie with the light flakey sugar sprinkled crust!

column4: 1111 E. Cabrillo Rd. Santa Barbara, CA  93103
column13: A good but relatively unimpressive meal, served on the slow side by under-experienced wait staff, who didn't seem to know Santa Barbara, never mind the menu...
L'Auberge is a lovely, intimate restaurant with attention to detail and expertly prepared food. Service is friendly and attentive without being intrusive.
Pricey for what we got. Limited menu.

Having experienced Robin's on our prior visit to Cambria, it was a no-brainer to revisit Robin's on this trip. The Roghan Josh curry, Tempeh Korma curry, Tofu pad thai and calamari were great, however the grilled Naan with bleu cheese and peaches kinda missed the mark. The chocolate torte was the perfect treat to compliment our dinner. Our server was just a tad gruff though attentive. If you are feeling somewhat adventuresome and want a dining experience that doesn't emulate other restaurants, look no further as this is your place.
Great bar with excellent selection of beers. Free range grass-fed beef cooked exactly as ordered.

column4: 7 W. Carrillo St. Santa Barbara, CA  93101
column13: Great food, service and reasonable prices. Love that you can get a glass of the house wine for just $5. Not very common to find here in Santa Barbara. Also very convenient if you attending a performance at the Granada.
The food and service was very good. A very nice night with lots of activity. We will definately return on our next visit.

I had a reservation for 7 for our department at work. We were very tight on time, so I decided to have everyone leave early for our lunch arrival. I had the advantage to call in our orders at 10AM and I was greeting warmly to that idea. Needless to say we had our meal shortly after we sat down and had 30 min to chat and travel back to the office.

column1: Louies Cajun Kitchen and Bourbon Bar
column13: The food was delicious. we were there on a Tuesday night and it was pretty quiet sans for a few tables, and some guys watching sports at the bar. Large drink list (I got a delicious cucumber cocktail). The waiter allowed my aunt to add fish to the portabella mushroom dish and modified it to make it even more delicious. I had swordfish that was flavored and cooked perfectly. If you are looking for a nicer meal in a more casual town like Santa Cruz, this is a great place!

column1: Sides Hardware and Shoes - A Brothers Restaurant
column4: 2375 Alamo Pintado Avenue Los Olivos, CA  93441
column13: Absolutely one of the best meals I've had in the past 5 years. There were 4 of us visiting the wine country in Los Olivos, California and all 4 of us agreed....ONE OF THE BEST!! Foodies will love the fried brussel sprouts as an appetizer. The lamb chop was tender with flavor. The seafood was out of this world. Service was great with the chef visiting our table asking our opinion of the meal. Can't wait for our next trip to Los Olivos.

Just lovely! Went for late lunch for my husbands 60th birthday and we could not have been more delighted with the scenic view (WOW!), the great service and the amazing food (and drinks - try the Mexitini).

column4: 100 Ocean View Ave. Pismo Beach, CA  93449
column13: Food quality was below average, server totally forgot to bring us our soup.They did bring us a complimentary dessert with a candle for our anniversary though.View is stunning. But again, the food had no flavor, very blah.

column4: 900 San Ysidro Lane Santa Barbara, CA  93108
column13: My wife and I went to The Stonehouse for our 1st wedding anniversary and had a wonderful evening. The food was great, the restaurant was lovely, and our server was very friendly. This was our first time at this restaurant and I'm sure we spend another anniversary or special occasion here in the future.

column4: 1215 Avila Beach Dr. San Luis Obispo, CA  93405
column13: This was our first visit and we will return---we ate in the bar area which was both romantic and cozy. The full menu was available there as well as a bar menu. The staff was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable. My wife had breast of chicken which was both generous and moist. I had a pasta dish, tagliatelle with vegetables that was excellent. For the full menu, except to pay in the mid 20 to low 30 dollar range but for a nice/special dinner, it was well worth it.
Excellent food for both dinner/lunch! Great views and the margarita's are awesome!
In or passing through Paso Robles a must for lunch.
Just adore this restaurant!!!!They have never let us down....Had a fabulous salmon dish....and Cindy loved her meal and the wine!!!

OK Mexican food, but nothing to write home about. The hostess was clueless about OpenTable, so the reservation was pointless. Fortunately, they had room for us. The dining room was dark and windowless; the fajitas ordered by a large group smoked up the whole room: there was poor air circulation. The server was friendly.

column4: 1151 Coast Village Rd. Santa Barbara, CA  93108
column13: We went on a Sunday expecting lunch however they only serve breakfast on Sundays. It was yummy!

column4: 1 Old Golf Course Road Monterey, CA  93940
column13: It was just okay. Good hotel restaurant. I would not seek them out for any occasion. Food just okay. It was surprisingly pricey.
Loved our experience so much we went back a second time. Will absolutely visit it every time we are in Paso Robles.

column4: 19 East Carmel Valley Rd Carmel Valley, CA  93924-9703
column13: Has been great in the past but was not this time
